entries.meaning: (topology) A crisp, clearly-defined object that exists within a more vaguely defined object.
examples: For two vague regions, one topological relation exists between any pair of crispings. There are a number of relations possible between the members of the sets of crisp regions on which the vague regions stand.

entries.meaning: (archaic) A process of curling or forming into ringlets.
examples: Wherefore are all your sleekings, and your curlings,Crispings, and paintings, and your skin made soft,And your face smooth with ointments  [â€¦]
